title: Ukrainian slider exits Games over helmet protest

title: Watch: BJP moves substantive motion against Rahul Gandhi, Nishikant Dubey seeks life-long ban

title: Tamil Nadu: Cong pushes back at Stalin's 'friends without benefits' line

Stalin firmly ruled out sharing governance with allies, asserting the DMK-Congress alliance remains intact. This public spat fuels speculation about the alliance's stability ahead of the 2026 elections.

title: Mega Rs 3.6L cr defence boost: Govt gives nod for 114 Rafale jets, missiles & P-8I aircraft
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council has approved the purchase of Rafale fighter jets from France for an estimated Rs 3.25 lakh crore. This significant procurement will see 80% of the jets manufactured in India, bolstering the Indian Air Force's fleet and addressing rising regional security concerns.

title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: What it is, who's coming, and why it matters
content: The India AI Impact Summit 2026, scheduled for February 16-20 at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi, is the first global AI summit hosted in the Global South. Google's Sundar Pichai, OpenAI's Sam Altman, Nvidia's Jensen Huang, and Anthropic's Dario Amodei are among the confirmed attendees. The five-day programme is built around three 'Sutras'‚ÄîPeople, Planet, Progress‚Äîand seven working groups called 'Chakras' covering AI safety, skilling, inclusion, and economic growth.

title: T20 World Cup: Why Abhishek Sharma is not playing against Namibia
content: India has opted to rest opener Abhishek Sharma for their T20 World Cup match against Namibia due to a stomach infection. Sharma, who was discharged from the hospital after two days, missed the game with Sanju Samson replacing him. Jasprit Bumrah also comes in for Mohammed Siraj in the bowling attack.

title: 'Amit Shah called me, then there was a raid': Cong's Bhupesh Baghel levels big charge
content: Former Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel claims Union home minister Amit Shah contacted him about ongoing cases, implying an offer to join the BJP. Baghel alleges the BJP uses investigative agencies against opposition leaders before offering a "washing machine" to cleanse them. He cited examples like Himanta Biswa Sarma and Ajit Pawar.

title: Italy register first-ever T20 World Cup win, thrash Nepal by 10 wickets
content: Italy achieved a historic maiden T20 World Cup victory, defeating Nepal by 10 wickets. After their spinners dismissed Nepal for 123, the Mosca brothers, Anthony and Justin, delivered a dominant unbeaten opening partnership to secure the win with 7.2 overs to spare.

title: Oracle can't stop explaining 'all is well' after $300 billion 'OpenAI Shock'
content: Oracle is actively promoting its AI data center progress and job creation efforts amidst significant investor concerns. The company's massive $300 billion OpenAI cloud contract, signed in September 2025, has led to a substantial stock decline and ballooning debt. Despite upbeat updates, market jitters persist over the startup's financial stability and Oracle's deep entanglement.

title: America wants AI girlfriends, China wants AI boyfriends - here's why
content: In the US and much of the English-speaking internet, AI companions are overwhelmingly designed for men. The typical AI girlfriend is endlessly available, emotionally affirming, flirtatious on demand, and crucially programmable. She does not reject. She does not argue unless asked to. She does not leave.

title: 'Didn't abuse anyone': Priyanka rejects Rijiju's claim of Cong MPs misbehaving with Speaker
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has vehemently denied Union minister Kiren Rijiju's claims that she encouraged Congress MPs to misbehave in the Lok Sabha Speaker's chamber.  She stated that no one was abused and that she was merely present, expressing her views peacefully. Rijiju had alleged that 20-25 Congress MPs verbally abused the Speaker and threatened the Prime Minister.

title: Macron says Musk has most billions of dollars from American taxpayers; Tesla CEO replies
content: French President Emmanuel Macron labeled Elon Musk "over-subsidised," citing Starlink as an example of public investment in European industry. Musk retorted, claiming European competitors receive more government funding than Tesla and SpaceX. Macron had previously accused Musk of political intervention in European elections.

title: Afghanistan players withdraw from Pakistan Super League auction; here's why
content: Afghanistan cricketers withdrew from the Pakistan Super League (PSL) Players' Auction following backlash over Rahmanullah Gurbaz's direct signing by Peshawar Zalmi. Strained diplomatic relations between Pakistan and Afghanistan are cited as the primary reason for the players' decision to pull out, impacting their participation in the tournament.

title: Rs 260cr settlement for family of Indian student killed by US police officer ‚Äî what is the case?
content: The family of Jaahnavi Kandula, a 23-year-old Indian student killed by a speeding police officer in Seattle, has secured a $29 million settlement. Kandula was struck and killed by an officer driving 74 mph while responding to an emergency. The incident gained further outrage after another officer was heard laughing about the crash on body camera footage.

title: 'Used for terror, fraud': Russia blocks WhatsApp for defying local laws
content: Responding separately to Russian news agency TASS, Peskov indicated that the platform could be restored if its parent company complies with local regulations. "This is a matter of compliance with Russian laws. If Meta complies, it will enter into dialogue with the Russian authorities, and then there will be an opportunity to reach an agreement," he said.

title: Nate Diaz teases UFC return as White House card 2026 hypes fans
content: Nate Diaz has sparked fresh talk about a return to the Ultimate Fighting Championship. The American fighter posted a mysterious message on social media this week. His comments came as the UFC prepares for a historic event planned at the White House in June. Fans immediately began guessing whether Diaz could appear on the card.

title: Unsold in IPL, Steve Smith becomes PSL's costliest signing
content: Steve Smith shattered PSL records, becoming the most expensive player at PKR 14 crore for the Sialkot Stallions. The revamped 11th edition features a new auction system and two new franchises. Naseem Shah was the top Pakistani buy, while Babar Azam was retained. The tournament runs March 26-May 3.

title: Kim Jong Un's teenage daughter being positioned as successor, South Korea says
content: South Korea's intelligence agency believes Kim Jong Un is grooming his teenage daughter, Kim Ju Ae, as his successor, signaling a potential fourth-generation dynasty. Her increasing public appearances at key events, including military functions and a visit to a sacred mausoleum, suggest a formal designation is imminent. This marks a significant shift in North Korea's traditionally male-dominated leadership.

title: Once, twice or thrice? How many times do we really fall madly in love, study reveals
content: A new study from the Kinsey Institute surveyed over 10,000 Americans. It found that most people experience passionate love only twice in their lives. This finding contrasts with romanticized portrayals in media. The study suggests that while intense love is rare, companionate love is a more enduring form of connection. This information is relevant for singles navigating modern dating.

title: 'Voiced concern over social media addiction': 27-year-old YouTuber held for slitting father‚Äôs throat
content: A 27-year-old YouTuber allegedly murdered her father in Korba, Chhattisgarh, after a heated argument over her social media addiction and content creation. The incident, which also involved a land dispute, saw the daughter fatally attack her father with a sickle while he slept. Police have arrested the accused, with investigations ongoing.

title: No World Cup for 18 years to now four in a row: How 2019 changed Namibia cricket
content: From missing World Cups for nearly two decades to qualifying for four in a row, Namibia‚Äôs rise has been built on central contracts, homegrown talent and long-term planning. After losing their opening match, Gerhard Erasmus-led side will take on defending champions India on Thursday.

title: Rammed, flung, crushed: 24-year-old woman killed after drunk Haryana cop‚Äôs car mows her down
content: A 24-year-old Gurgaon-based professional, Nikita Bajaj, was killed in Ambala Cantonment after an e-rickshaw she was travelling in was hit from behind by a car allegedly driven at high speed by a police head constable. She was run over and declared dead at hospital. The accused was detained, and allegations of intoxication are under investigation.

title: Rajpal Yadav cheque bounce case: Actor to remain in jail, next hearing on Feb 16
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has surrendered to Tihar jail and will continue to remain in jail. He failed to repay debts amounting to Rs 9 crore. The court refused his bail plea, citing a family wedding. Judicial procedure must be followed. Yadav's counsel argued for bail, proposing security deposit. The matter is listed for further hearing. Bollywood celebrities are supporting Yadav and pledging financial help.

title: Quote of the day by Lindsey Vonn: 'I‚Äôm never tired of winning'
content: Lindsey Vonn embodied resilience after a devastating Olympic crash, updating fans from hospital following her third successful surgery on a complex leg fracture. The 41-year-old, who had also ruptured her ACL days earlier, stressed that ‚Äúsuccess‚Äù now means recovery. After returning from retirement in 2024 and dominating World Cup races, Vonn‚Äôs comeback inspired fans and athletes alike. Her quote, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm never tired of winning,‚Äù reflects her relentless spirit and refusal to surrender to injury or doubt.

title: Sand Martin manager found dead in office building in Gurgaon
content: A 33-year-old manager was found dead at the base of his office building in Gurgaon's Spaze IT Park. Police are investigating the incident as a suspected suicide, with CCTV footage showing the man alone on the terrace shortly before his death. His family has been informed, and no foul play is currently suspected.

title: 'Leadership will take call whenever they find suitable': DKS amid CM tussle
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has dismissed speculation about a leadership change, stating no discussions on the chief ministerial post occurred during his meetings with Congress leaders. He emphasized the party's focus on its broader vision and goals, with senior leaders to make decisions at an opportune time.

title: Sarla Maheshwari, one of Doordarshan‚Äôs most familiar faces, dies at 71
content: Veteran Doordarshan news anchor Sarla Maheshwari, a prominent figure in 1980s Indian television journalism, passed away at 71. Known for her calm demeanor and clear diction, she was a trusted voice in Indian households for nearly three decades, defining credibility in the medium's formative years. Her passing marks the end of a significant era in television news.

title: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôll do it our way‚Äô: Frustrated Namibia questions night practice disparity with India
content: Namibia's captain, Gerhard Erasmus, expressed frustration over the T20 World Cup schedule, noting his team received no night training sessions despite facing India in a night fixture.  Erasmus highlighted the lack of floodlit practice facilities in Namibia, making the adjustment difficult for his players. Despite the disadvantage, the team is prepared to compete in their own 'Namibian way'.

title: No tariff to Indian textile: Piyush Goyal clarifies on US trade deal after B'desh pact
content: Goyal also stressed that the India-US trade deal, which reduces tariffs on Indian exports to 18%, does not touch sensitive agriculture and dairy sectors. On Saturday, India and the US had released a joint statement on the trade agreement.

title: 'Sectarian agenda': Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind chief criticises govt's mandate on Vande Mataram
content: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind president Arshad Madani criticised the Union Government's mandate to sing all six stanzas of 'Vande Mataram' in schools and official functions. He stated the decision infringes on religious freedom and minority rights, as some verses contradict monotheistic beliefs. Madani argued the move reflects electoral politics and a sectarian agenda rather than patriotism.

title: Sarla Maheshwari, iconic DD newsreader, passes away at 71
content: Sarla Maheshwari, one of the most recognisable faces of Doordarshan‚Äôs retro era, passed away on Thursday.  Maheshwari became a household name during the 1980s and 1990s, when Doordarshan dominated the television news space in India. For nearly three decades, from 1976 until 2005, she delivered Hindi news bulletins with composure and clarity, earning admiration for her measured tone and flawless diction.

title: A winning dressing room is a smiling dressing room: Gautam Gambhir
content: Returning to his hometown Delhi for the match against Namibia, India's head coach Gautam Gambhir emphasised the importance of team togetherness in the demanding world of elite sports. He highlighted how support staff become like family, fostering a relaxed atmosphere during practice. Gambhir candidly stated that only a winning dressing room brings smiles, underscoring the pressure of professional cricket.

title: ‚ÄòBe ready for exemplary costs‚Äô: SC raps Congress MP Jairam Ramesh ‚Äî why
content: The Supreme Court sternly rebuked Congress MP Jairam Ramesh for challenging an Office Memorandum that aimed to implement the court's ruling against retrospective environmental clearances. ‚ÄúBe ready for exemplary costs. We know the design behind this,‚Äù a bench led by CJI Surya Kant said. Justices warned of hefty costs, viewing the challenge as an indirect attack on the apex court's judgment itself. Ramesh subsequently withdrew his plea.

title: Overturning family court order: Why Delhi HC allowed early mutual divorce plea
content: The parties got married on 30 March 2025, at Arya Samaj Mandir, Khirki Village, New Delhi and registered their marriage on 2 April 2025 with the office of the District Magistrate, South Delhi. It was an admitted position before the Court that the parties never cohabited even for a single day after the marriage, the marriage was never consummated, and both continued residing at their respective parental homes immediately thereafter.

title: World's most powerful passports: Indian passport at 75th spot; check top 10 list
content: At present, India is placed at the 75th position in the index. However, it still trails several countries when measured by the number of destinations that allow Indian passport holders visa-free entry or provide visa-on-arrival access.

title: How 4 women are protecting children in a village surrounded by tigers
content: In Maharashtra's Sitaram Peth village, bordering Tadoba Tiger Sanctuary, four women have taken on the dangerous task of escorting children to school. Facing constant tiger threats on a dark, unlit road, these mothers bravely patrol with sticks and torches, ensuring the children's safe passage to and from the bus stand, driven by the strength of their maternal love.

title: 'Being woke is one thing, but ... ':SC flays makers of 'Ghooskhor Pandat'; directs title change
content: The Supreme Court has ordered Netflix and the makers of the film "Ghooskhor Pandit" to change its title, deeming it denigrative of a particular community. The bench emphasized that no section of society should be disparaged, citing constitutional principles of fraternity and the need for responsible speech.

title: From ice hockey to T20 WC‚Äôs youngest talents: Ajayveer finds ‚Äògreat feeling‚Äô in Delhi
content: Ajayveer Hundal, a 20-year-old Canadian cricketer, shares his journey from ice hockey to the sport's biggest stage. Born to Indian parents, Hundal discovered his love for cricket during the 2019 World Cup. He trained in India to hone his skills. Hundal now plays in the T20 World Cup, a dream come true.

title: Why is stock market down today? Top reasons for Rs 3 lakh crore selloff
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the benchmark indices of the stock market, tanked in trade on Thursday, with IT stocks leading the decline. Technology stocks led the downturn, with Tech Mahindra, Infosys and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) falling nearly 6 per cent each.

title: Road rage in Bengaluru: Man clings to car bonnet, dragged for 1km on Old Airport Road ‚Äî watch
content: In a jaw-dropping scene on Old Airport Road, a goods vehicle operator clashed with a car driver over a minor fender bender. Upset over the incident, the truck driver perched himself on the car's hood, only for the enraged car owner to speed off, dragging him for a whole kilometer before he could break free.

title: What unfolded in Lok Speaker Om Birla's chamber on Feb 4? Rijiju releases video clip
content: Union parliamentary affairs minister Kiren Rijiju released a video he said was secretly filmed by a Congress MP inside Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla‚Äôs chamber. He alleged that 20‚Äì25 Congress MPs entered, behaved abusively and issued threats. The row comes amid escalating tensions in Parliament, with the opposition accusing Birla of partisanship and the government condemning repeated disruptions.

title: 'Linked with anti-India forces': BJP MP moves motion to revoke Rahul Gandhi's Parliament membership
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has moved a motion in the Lok Sabha seeking termination of Rahul Gandhi's parliamentary membership and a lifetime ban from elections, accusing him of misleading the nation with "anti-India forces." The motion follows Gandhi's speech alleging the Centre compromised national interests by allowing the US to weaponize energy and financial systems.

title: ‚ÄòWe are in match zone‚Äô: Tilak Varma fires India-Pak warning ahead of T20 WC blockbuster
content: India batter Tilak Varma expressed excitement for the upcoming ICC Men's T20 World Cup clash against Pakistan on February 15, stating the team has entered "match zone" after fixture confirmation. Varma emphasised a methodical approach, focusing on one match at a time with video analysis and adapting to wicket conditions.

title: Court Denies Bail To Luthra Brothers In Goa Nightclub Fire Case
content: A court in Goa on Thursday dismissed the bail applications of Saurabh Luthra and Gaurav Luthra, both owners of the Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub where 25 people were killed in a devastating fire in December last year.

title: Brazilian President To Visit India From Feb 18-22, Participate In AI Summit
content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will pay a state visit to India from February 18 to 22 at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, marking another significant moment in the deepening India-Brazil strategic partnership.

title: Purchase Of 114 Rafales, India's Biggest Military Buy, Clears Major Hurdle
content: India has approved a proposal worth Rs 3.25 lakh crore to procure 114 Rafale fighter jets for the Indian Air Force (IAF), marking the biggest defence acquisition in the country's history.

title: Update 3- Russia confirms ban on WhatsApp, says it failed to abide by law
content: Russia has blocked the popular messaging service WhatsApp over its failure to comply with local legislation, the Kremlin said Thursday, urging its 100 million Russian users to switch to a domestic alternative.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hardeep Puri On "Exotic Island", "Have Fun" Mails To Epstein
content: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, in an exclusive interview with NDTV, issued a clarification on his past interactions with the disgraced American financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Rajpal Yadav To Stay In Jail At Least Till Monday In Rs 9-Crore Debt Case
content: Rajpal Yadav, who was sent to prison in a Rs 9-crore debt case, will remain in jail at least till Monday, with the Delhi High Court adjourning the hearing on the actor's interim bail peititon until then.

title: 55 Years After Bangladesh Liberation, Yunus' 'Birth Of New Nation' Remark
content: Bangladesh Election 2026: Over five decades after Bangladesh rose from the ashes of war in 1971, the country is once again standing at what many believe is a turning point in its history.

title: India To Send Air Force Instructors To UK To Train British Fighter Pilots
content: A major facility of Britain's air force responsible for creating the UK's next generation of world-class fighter pilots will get new trainers from India, a statement said.

title: Man kills 2 Neighbours On Suspicion Of Witchcraft In Madhya Pradesh: Cops
content: A man, who could not become father after his wife suffered a miscarriage, allegedly killed two of his neighbours on Thursday, accusing them of practising witchcraft in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli district, police said.

title: 4 Days To Arrest Shivam Mishra After Lamborghini Crash, Bail Within Hours
content: Lamborghini Crash Shivam Mishra Bail: Shivam Mishra, son of tobacco tycoon KK Mishra, has been granted bail this afternoon, just hours after he was arrested this morning in the Kanpur Lamborghini car crash.

title: Bird-Hit Incidents Reported At Airports Rose To 1,782 In 2025: Centre
content: The number of bird-hit incidents reported at the country's airports jumped to 1,782 last year from 1,278 recorded in 2024, the government told the Lok Sabha on Thursday.

title: NDTV Asks Supriya Sule On NCP Merger. Her "Ajit Pawar No More" Response
content: On a day the two NCP factions were reportedly supposed to merge before Ajit Pawar's death last month, NCP (Sharadchandra Pawar) MP Supriya Sule said, "What is there to talk about now that dada (Ajit Pawar) is no more?"

title: Dispute Over Milk Takes Nasty Turn As Woman Chews Farmer's Finger
content: A woman allegedly bit and chewed a farmer's finger following a heated argument after he refused to provide her with cow's milk in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district on Thursday, police said.

title: Denied Free Stay, Foreigner Tries To Slit His Throat Outside Delhi Hotel
content: A foreign national tried to take his own life on Wednesday after the staff refused his request for a free stay.

title: Bangladesh Election 2026 LIVE: Voting Closes In Bangladesh Polls
content: Bangladesh Election 2026 Voting Live Updates: Bangladeshi is voting today in a crucial national election, the first since the July 2024 uprising that ended former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's 15 years of iron-fisted rule.

title: 'Return To India If You Want Your Case Heard': High Court To Vijay Mallya
content: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya must return to India if he wants his petition against a law that designated him a fugitive to be heard, the Bombay High Court said today.

title: India's Energy Shift, Defence Ties Seen As Win Against China: Top US Official
content: The US views India's gradual reduction in Russian oil imports and its deepening defence partnership with Washington as a strategic gain that strengthens the balance of power in the Indo-Pacific, a senior US official told lawmakers.

title: BJP MP Makes 1st Move In Bid To Disqualify Rahul Gandhi From Parliament
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has initiated a formal process seeking to disqualify Congress MP Rahul Gandhi from the Lok Sabha. Dubey's move came amid acrimonious exchanges between Rahul Gandhi and BJP MPs over several controversial issues.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The JF-17 'Hype': How Pak Is Pushing A Jet That's More Noise Than Substance
content: Even if the JF-17 may seem like a popular choice for many nations, interoperability is not exportable, nor is effective warfighting capability.

title: India Okays Rs 3.25 Lakh Crore Deal To Buy 114 Rafale Fighter Jets
content: The Defence Ministry on Thursday approved the Rs 3.25 lakh crore proposal to buy 114 Rafale fighter jets from France for the Indian Air Force, according to reliable sources.

title: Liverpool summon grit, resolve that could carry them to Champions League places
content: liverpool beat sunderland 1-0 at the stadium of light on saturday . the hosts looked set to extend their impressive home record . Virgil van Dijk rising highest to nod home what would be the winning goal .

title: Bittersweet silver: Chock and Bates' Olympic chapter ends 1.43 points from gold
content: Madison Chock and Evan Bates have won their fourth Olympic Games together . the pair had just received their silver medals in figure skating ice dance . they had fought fiercely over the past four years, and had been the overwhelming favorites .

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Virginia Tech gets biggest victory yet with Clemson upset
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections . the selection committee will evaluate a team's underlying potential .

title: Power Rankings: A big week for the top of the Big 12
content: eight new members since 2023 and the departure of league powers Texas and Oklahoma to the SEC in 2024 . the Bears sit atop the Big 12 standings at 10-2 and are seeking their first regular season title since last winning its 12th consecutive crown in 2022 .

title: Power Rankings: Michigan, Arizona, UConn shuffle at the top
content: the top seven teams in last week's Power Rankings went 8-7 in the span of seven days, with Michigan accounting for three of those wins . all four of those teams lost: UConn to St. John's at Madison Square Garden on Friday; Duke at the buzzer to North Carolina on Saturday; Illinois in overtime to Michigan State on Sunday; and Arizona at Kansas . the carnage extended down the rankings more than expected .

title: Premier League's 50 worst transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
content: the richest clubs in the premier league have sometimes been able to overcome some poor decisions in the transfer market . some of the best teams in league history have been built around exactly that . a man's injury history began after he made a big-money move .

title: Who wins the Olympic men's hockey tournament? Intel on all 12 countries
content: teams representing 12 countries will compete beginning Wednesday . most of the countries featuring NHL players for the first time since the 2014 games in sochi . the 2026 games will be the 10th golden victory for Canada . a team of hockey players will compete in the preliminary round .
